snippet: The Federal Trade Commission said merging the ProMedica Health System and St. Luke’s Hospital would “substantially lessen competition” around Toledo, leading to higher prices.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission blocks the merger of Ohio hospitals ProMedica Health System and St Luke's Hospital, saying that it would substantially lessen competition and allow the hospitals to charge higher prices; ruling is seen as a sign that regulators may reject the consolidation of medical providers promoted by the new health care legislation as a violation of antitrust law.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission said merging the ProMedica Health System and St. Luke’s Hospital would “substantially lessen competition” around Toledo, leading to higher prices.

headline.seo: In Ohio, F.T.C. Bans ProMedica-St. Luke’s Merger
headline.main: Regulator Orders Hospitals to Undo a Merger in Ohio
headline.print_headline: Regulator Orders Hospitals To Undo a Merger in Ohio

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
